column4: hey all, um, so i did this system update yesterday, everything is working fantasticy except that totem cant open anything
yeh vlc is no go too
its like some codec file has been updated and mashed
american chopper AVI but id watched it before
cool, thanks
hey all, i just installed automatix2 because well, it exists. so its "updating my sources list" and its stops on
oh, looks like its sorted itself out
we don't support automatix systems
by using automatix you risk losing your community support
read the link ubotu said to learn more about automatix
because you've not insalled the w32 codecs
i have indeed
then its probably the wrong codec for the others
what command are you using
what do you mean?
what command generates that error
sudo mount -a
in your fstab do you have any remove hosts
nothing should have changed, i only moved my machine about 5 yards
check if you have remote hosts in your fstab
//192.168.1.2/PUBLIC\040DISK\0401 /media/NAS200/200Gig cifs auto,iocharset=utf8,uid=evilsherpa,gid=users,credentials=/root/.cifscredentials,file_mode=0775,dir_mode=0775 0 0
thats the problem then
no route to host 192.x.x.x
